intro: Tithymalus × pseudolucidus, commonly known as the hybrid tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady garden settings. Due to its ornamental value and fragrance, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
